reports.extracted_content:
# Leads Agri Foliar/Biostimulant Demo Form

## Fields
- **Name/Position/Area**: JOEL ANOS O. MOLINA / TPS ZAMBALES
- **Leads Agri Product (Rate/Timing/No of applications)**: ISMART NANO UREA
- **Name of Cooperator**: MICHAEL D. RANGES
- **Farm Location**: PI DIRITA, IBA, ZAMBALES
- **Contact Number**: 09932616074
- **Plot size (sq meter)**: 1000 sqm
- **Date of Application**: APRIL 4, 2025
- **Crop/Variety**: RICE / NSIC RC 534
- **Date of Planting**: MARCH 4, 2025
- **Farmers Practice (Product/Rate/Timing)**: FEB 9, 2024
- **Date of Product Demo Showcase/s**: N/A
- **Total Move-out**: N/A
- **Name and Signature of Demo Cooperator**: MICHAEL RANGES
- **No of Participants**: N/A

## Treatment
| Treatment | Product        | Rate | Application Method | Timing/s of application |
|-----------|----------------|------|--------------------|-------------------------|
| 1         | FP/Untreated   | N/A  | N/A                | N/A                     |
| 2         | Leads Agri     | 50ml | Foliar             | 31 DAT                  |

## Crop Vigor (whole plot)
| Trt | Product        | # of tillers (10 DAA) | # of tillers (18 DAA) | LCC (10 DAA) | LCC (18 DAA) |
|-----|----------------|-----------------------|-----------------------|--------------|--------------|
| 1   | FP/Untreated   | 16                    | 19                    | 4            | 3            |
| 2   | Leads Agri     | 18                    | 20                    | 4            | 4            |

## Yield (MT/Ha)
| Product      | Yield |
|--------------|-------|
| FP/Untreated | N/A   |
| Leads Agri   | N/A   |

## Notes
- At 10 DAA, the results were almost the same for both the treated and untreated. The leaves were both green. However, the treated had more tillers. Meanwhile, at 18 DAA, the leaves of the treated were greener.

data_quality.reliability_notes: FP application timing is unclear/inconsistent ('FEB 9, 2024' is a date, not a description). Plot size of 1000 sqm is small for a comprehensive yield demo. Only two measurement intervals were recorded for performance assessment. Yield and commercial data are missing.

treatment_comparison.protocol_assessment: Leads Agri application timing (31 DAT) is appropriate for rice tillering. The comparison against an untreated control is fair. However, the specific timing/details for Farmer's Practice are unclear/missing. The number of applications for both treatments is not explicitly stated.

performance_analysis.raw_data_notes: Data includes tillers (count) and LCC (1-5 rating scale, where 1=Pale, 5=Dark Green).

calculated_metrics.improvement_interpretation: Leads Agri resulted in an average of 1.5 more tillers per plot, representing an 8.57% increase compared to the control.

statistical_assessment.significance_basis: 8.57% improvement in tiller count, falling within the 5-15% moderate significance range. LCC also showed an average 0.5 point improvement (14.29% higher) for Leads Agri, which is also considered moderate significance.
statistical_assessment.notes: Positive trends for both tillers and LCC are consistent across the two measurement points. Confidence is medium due to limited data points and small plot size.

trend_analysis.early_performance: At 10 DAA, Leads Agri showed 2 more tillers (18 vs 16) while LCC was similar (4 for both).
trend_analysis.late_performance: At 18 DAA, Leads Agri maintained a higher tiller count (20 vs 19) and prevented the decline in LCC observed in the control (4 vs 3).
trend_analysis.key_observation: Leads Agri consistently enhanced tillering and sustained leaf color (LCC) by 18 DAA, indicating improved plant vigor and nutrient utilization compared to the control, especially in the later assessment.

cooperator_feedback.raw_feedback: At 10 DAA, the results were almost the same for both the treated and untreated. The leaves were both green. However, the treated had more tillers. Meanwhile, at 18 DAA, the leaves of the treated were greener.
key_highlights: More tillers observed by 10 DAA for treated.
Greener leaves observed by 18 DAA for treated.
cooperator_feedback.visible_results_timeline: Tillers visible by 10 DAA, greener leaves by 18 DAA.

warnings: The 'Farmers Practice (Product/Rate/Timing)' field contains an inconsistent date ('FEB 9, 2024') instead of product/rate/timing details.
Yield data is critical for a fertilizer/biostimulant product but is currently missing.
Commercial performance metrics (participants, total sales) are not available.
assumptions: Assumed LCC scale is 1-5 where 1=Pale and 5=Dark Green.
Assumed 1 application for both treatments as number of applications was not specified.
Interpreted 'FEB 9, 2024' for FP timing as an error/placeholder and marked FP timing as N/A.

risk_factors.data_basis: Yield is N/A, which is essential for demonstrating economic value of a fertilizer/biostimulant.
Single demo location (PI Dirita, Iba, Zambales), small plot size (1000 sqm), and only two assessment intervals (10 DAA, 18 DAA) reduce the generalizability and statistical robustness of the findings.
The 8.57% improvement in tiller count and 0.5 point LCC improvement are positive but fall into the 'moderate' significance category, suggesting further trials could aim for stronger differentiation.

opportunities.opportunity: Positive impact on early crop vigor
opportunities.data_basis: ISMART NANO UREA consistently led to higher tiller counts and better sustained leaf color compared to control, indicating enhanced plant health and nutrient uptake.
The cooperator observed tangible benefits ('more tillers', 'greener leaves') within 10-18 DAA, providing valuable anecdotal evidence for farmer adoption.
Initial differences in tillering were noted as early as 10 DAA, which can be a strong selling point for farmers.

recommendations.recommendation: Conduct follow-up trials to collect comprehensive yield data for ISMART NANO UREA.
recommendations.data_basis: Yield data is critical for demonstrating the economic value of a fertilizer/biostimulant product and is currently missing (N/A). Performance metrics (tillers, LCC) show positive trends, warranting yield validation.
recommendations.expected_impact: Provide conclusive evidence of economic benefit, strengthening product claims and market positioning, and enabling calculation of Return on Investment (ROI).

recommendations.recommendation: Expand demo sites across various regions and increase the frequency of performance metric measurements.
recommendations.data_basis: The current demo is single-location with only two measurement intervals. Expanding scope and data points will enhance the reliability and generalizability of results, providing a more robust understanding of product performance under different conditions.
recommendations.expected_impact: Improve the statistical significance and confidence level of findings, identify broader applicability, and capture more nuanced product effects over the full crop cycle.

recommendations.recommendation: Plan and execute product demo showcases for farmers, leveraging the positive early vigor observations.
recommendations.data_basis: No commercial metrics (participants, total sales) are available, indicating the demo showcase has not yet occurred. The cooperator's positive feedback and visible early results (enhanced tillering, greener leaves) provide a strong foundation for farmer engagement.
recommendations.expected_impact: Generate initial sales, gather direct farmer feedback, build market awareness and demand for ISMART NANO UREA, and start collecting commercial performance data.

analysis.executive_summary: ISMART NANO UREA produced an average of 19 tillers per plot compared to 17.5 for control (1.5 tillers increase, 8.57% improvement). The cooperator observed more tillers by 10 DAA and greener leaves by 18 DAA for the treated plot. Commercial results are pending as the demo showcase has not yet been conducted.

suggested_charts.title: Tiller Count Trend: ISMART NANO UREA vs. Control (RICE)
suggested_charts.description: This chart illustrates the progression of tiller counts for ISMART NANO UREA treated plots compared to the Farmer's Practice (Control) over two measurement intervals, highlighting consistent improvement in tillering.

title.text: Tiller Count Trend: ISMART NANO UREA vs. Control (RICE)

suggested_charts.title: Leaf Color Chart (LCC) Rating Trend: ISMART NANO UREA vs. Control
suggested_charts.description: This chart shows the Leaf Color Chart (LCC) ratings over time, indicating the impact of ISMART NANO UREA on leaf greenness and nutrient status, preventing decline at 18 DAA compared to the control.

title.text: Leaf Color Chart (LCC) Rating Trend: ISMART NANO UREA vs. Control

suggested_charts.title: Relative Tiller Improvement: ISMART NANO UREA (8.57%)
suggested_charts.description: This chart highlights the 8.57% relative improvement in tiller count achieved by ISMART NANO UREA compared to the control, indicating enhanced early crop vigor.

title.text: Relative Tiller Improvement: ISMART NANO UREA (8.57%)

graph_suggestions.summary: The charting strategy focuses on illustrating the performance trends of ISMART NANO UREA against a control. Line charts effectively visualize the progression of tiller counts and LCC ratings over time, showing consistent improvement and sustained plant vigor. A bar chart (simulating a gauge for KPI) emphasizes the quantifiable relative improvement in tiller count, highlighting a key benefit for decision-makers. These charts collectively present a clear picture of the product's positive impact on early crop development.
